programme.desc: The Itchy Brain Simulation: Leonard worries that Sheldon will overreact when he confesses that he failed to return a DVD to the rental shop seven years earlier.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Thanksgiving Decoupling: Howard takes the gang to his mother's house for Thanksgiving to protect himself from his grumpy father-in-law who has also been invited.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Discovery Dissipation: Sheldon feels guilty when he gets attention for his accidental discovery of a new element. Raj stays with Howard and Bernadette for a week.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper Extraction: Sheldon has to go back to Texas when his sister goes into labour. While he's away, the gang gather at the flat to decorate the Christmas tree.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hesitation Ramification: Penny's big TV acting break hits the cutting-room floor, so Leonard does his best to comfort her, which leads her to ask him a bold question.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Occupation Recalibration: Penny quits her job at the restaurant to pursue her acting career full-time. Bernadette accidentally destroys one of Howard's comics.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Convention Conundrum: After the guys miss out on Comic-Con tickets, Sheldon decides to hold his own comic book convention. The girls take tea at a swanky hotel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotive Manipulation: Love is in the air when Amy convinces Sheldon to join her for a romantic train trip to Napa Valley to celebrate Valentine's Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Table Polarization: Leonard buys a dining table for the flat but Sheldon objects to such a big change inside his home. Meanwhile, Howard gets the chance to return to space.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Friendship Turbulence: In an attempt to improve their strained friendship, Howard invites Sheldon to visit NASA with him. Penny is upset when her car breaks down.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Mommy Observation: Sheldon pays a surprise visit to his mother in Houston and is forced to confront a new reality. Raj throws a murder mystery-themed dinner party.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Indecision Amalgamation: Raj has a dating dilemma. Penny can't decide whether to accept a role in a terrible film. Sheldon chooses between two gaming systems.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Relationship Diremption: Sheldon wonders whether he's wasting his time with his study of string theory. Raj and Emily go on a double date with Howard and Bernadette.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Anything Can Happen Recurrence: Penny and Leonard distract Sheldon from his career problems by reinstating Anything Can Happen Thursday. Raj asks for Howard's advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Transmogrification: Sheldon struggles to process his feelings of grief when his idol Professor Proton passes away. The gang gather to celebrate Star Wars Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gorilla Dissolution: Penny re-evaluates her life, including taking a big step with Leonard, while Howard and Bernadette struggle to look after Mrs Wolowitz.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Status Quo Combustion: With potential changes affecting different aspects of his personal and professional life, Sheldon is forced to confront an uncertain future.

programme.title: Live Football: Morocco v Comoros
programme.desc: The Africa Cup of Nations begins. The Atlas Lions are strong. Hosts. Bookies' favourites. Recent World Cup semi-finalists. But the Coelacanths are hardly fossils. Can they cause an upset?

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The Gig and the Girlfriend: To impress a girl in the year below, Simon attends his first concert since he saw Take That with his mum. But Will, Jay and Neil tag along too.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will's Dilemma: Simon and his new girlfriend Tara double date with Will and Tara's friend Kerry, but Will wonders if it's worth spending time with a girl he finds boring.

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: (2018) Comedy. Mark Wahlberg and Rose Byrne star as a couple whose orderly lives are disrupted when they foster three kids. Based on director Sean Anders' own experience.

programme.title: Jackass Forever
programme.desc: (2022) Outrageous adult comedy with Johnny Knoxville. The Jackasses reunite to test if older really is wiser by inflicting more playfully real pain on each other - just for fun of course.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Zoe Ball, Harry Redknapp, Denise Van Outen, Mo Gilligan and other famous faces think of our top telly and films, including Britain's Got Talent, Misery and The Favourite?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hofstadter Insufficiency: Sheldon and Penny bond while Leonard is away. Raj finds someone to share his heartache. Bernadette and Amy attract male attention at a conference.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Deception Verification: Leonard returns early from his research expedition as a surprise for Penny, but Sheldon becomes upset that he wasn't in on the secret.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Mercedes races to find the money for her blackmailer. Dillon and Rex try to support a struggling Ste. Donny and Misbah's relationship is on the rocks. And Frankie gets a threatening letter.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Donny and Misbah's relationship is on the rocks. Frankie receives a threatening letter. And Mercedes wants to turn over a new leaf with Warren.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Christmas festivities are in full swing in the village, as Warren and Mercedes look forward to the future and Frankie confides in Dodger.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotion Interruption: Leonard and Amy take an impromptu road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon when his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Penny has an interview.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Junior Professor Solution: When Sheldon has to teach a course at the university, Howard enrols in his class. Tension brews between Penny and Bernadette.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The First Pitch Insufficiency: Howard's nervous when NASA ask him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game. Sheldon claims his and Amy's relationship is the best in the gang.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hook-Up Reverberation: Raj's honesty about his past comes back to haunt him when his girlfriend Emily gives Penny the cold shoulder. The guys consider an investment.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Focus Attenuation: The guys attempt to invent something of scientific importance but only come up with new and enjoyable ways to procrastinate.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Expedition Approximation: Sheldon and Raj try to find out if they could survive a dark-matter research expedition in a salt mine by simulating the conditions in a tunnel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Misinterpretation Agitation: A smitten doctor turns up at Penny's door after her flirtatious sales techniques for the pharmaceutical company work a little too well.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Prom Equivalency: The girls decide to re-enact their high school proms with their current partners on the roof of the apartment building.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Septum Deviation: When Leonard has to have minor surgery on his nose, Sheldon is the one who seems to need sympathy. Raj is upset when his parents split up.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Champagne Reflection: Sheldon and Amy record the final episode of their internet show Fun with Flags. Penny tells Bernadette how her colleagues really feel about her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Clean Room Infiltration: Amy hosts a Victorian Christmas Eve dinner, complete with party games. Raj, Leonard and Howard have pigeon problems.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Space Probe Disintegration: Howard tries to calm a stressed Raj, who is anxiously awaiting the arrival of some data from a space probe that he helped launch.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Anxiety Optimization: When Sheldon gets stuck in a rut with his research, he asks his friends to cure his mental block by raising his stress levels.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Troll Manifestation: Leonard and Sheldon co-publish a physics paper but are forced to defend themselves against negative comments from an online critic.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic Book Store Regeneration: The gang prepare for the reopening of Stuart's comic book shop. Penny teaches Sheldon to 'let it go' when he is irritated.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Intimacy Acceleration: When the gang hear about an experiment designed to make participants fall in love, Sheldon and Penny put it to the test as a joke.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Colonization Application: Amy learns that Sheldon has applied to take part in a one-way mission to colonise Mars. Leonard surprises Penny with a gift.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Leftover Thermalization: A power cut at Mrs Wolowitz's house defrosts the last meal she prepared before her death, so the gang consume it in her honour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Skywalker Incursion: When Leonard and Sheldon are invited to speak at Berkeley, they take a detour during the journey to try to meet one of their idols.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Fortification Implementation: When Sheldon and Amy build a blanket fort, they come to a major crossroads in their relationship. Howard meets his half-brother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Communication Deterioration: Raj is asked to create a message for NASA to use if one of their missions finds alien life. Penny considers taking up acting again.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Graduation Transmission: Leonard is invited to make a speech at his old high school. Howard and Sheldon can't make a toy drone fly.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Maternal Combustion: Personalities collide when Sheldon and Leonard's mothers finally meet. Howard decides to 'man up' and do his share of the housework.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Commitment Determination: Sheldon pressures Leonard and Penny to choose a date for their wedding while dealing with changes in his own relationship.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: There's festive cheer in the Hutchinson household this Christmas, but an unexpected present sends the day into turmoil... Meanwhile, Jack has an extra-special mission up his sleeve.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grift of the Magi: After Bart breaks his coccyx and ends up using a wheelchair, Principal Skinner foolishly hires Fat Tony to build ramps at the school.

programme.title: First Dates at Christmas
programme.desc: Fred and the team pull out all the stops to create an unforgettable Christmas. Can a jobbing Father Christmas find a mate? And will panto actor John meet a tall, dark, handsome partner?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Celebrity Race Across the World, All's Fair, Squid Game: The Challenge, The 1% Club, Come Dine with Me: Teens and Police Interceptors.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: The celebrities watch Little Fires Everywhere, The Titan Games, Casino Royale, World Cup Final '66: England v West Germany, Naked Attraction, and Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: (1961) Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel. Two men fleeing the US Civil War find an island inhabited by monsters (animated by Ray Harryhausen) and the mysterious Captain Nemo.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: The Menu
programme.desc: (2022) Horror with Ralph Fiennes and Anya Taylor-Joy. Only one diner at an exclusive eatery sees through the foam quenelles to the pile of steaming prairie oysters beyond. Mayhem ensues.

programme.title: Nightmare Alley
programme.desc: (2021) Guillermo del Toro's star-studded carny thriller with Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett. Can a chancer with a dark past use clairvoyancy to fleece rich New Yorkers out of a fortune?

programme.title: The Vourdalak
programme.desc: (2023) Darkly comic Gothic horror about the travails of a foppish emissary of the King of France in a gloomy forest inhabited by a very odd family. With Kacey Mottet Klein. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: (1970) Oscar-winning drama portraying the bombing of Pearl Harbor, from both American and Japanese perspectives. With Joseph Cotten and So Yamamura.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: (2023) Action thriller starring Gerard Butler as an airline pilot who must become a one-man army after crashlanding on an island overrun by bad guys. To survive, he's gonna have to wing it.

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for...
programme.desc: ...Peculiar Children: (2016) Eva Green and Asa Butterfield star in Tim Burton's fantasy adventure. A teenager enters the magical, but scary and violent, world where his grandfather grew up.

programme.title: Our Ladies
programme.desc: (2019) Raucous teen comedy. A group of Catholic school girls hit Edinburgh for a choir competition, but they're more interested in debauchery than singing.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Tree Fairy
programme.desc: Family drama. A deaf girl who finds herself left out at Christmas asks a signing fairy to grant a special wish.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: (1997) Family fantasy comedy-adventure starring Jim Broadbent and Celia Imrie. A family of miniscule people live beneath the floorboards of a regular-sized family's house.

programme.title: Dream Horse
programme.desc: (2020) Uplifting fact-based comedy drama with Toni Collette and Damian Lewis. Welsh villagers club together to save up, buy a racehorse, and bring joy back to their town.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: Happiest Season
programme.desc: (2020) Kristen Stewart and Mackenzie Davis star as a couple who are about to lob an outing grenade into the family Christmas in Clea DuVall's darkly comic festive romance.

programme.title: The Favourite
programme.desc: (2018) Historical dark comedy starring an Oscar-winning Olivia Colman as eccentric monarch Queen Anne, with Rachel Weisz and Emma Stone vying to become her favourite.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: (2022) Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.desc: Andrew and Miriam present Monday to Thursday mornings. When the news happens, it happens here. GB News brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from across the UK.

programme.desc: Tackling the big stories from all angles and perspectives. Weekdays from midday, Tom Harwood and Nana Akua bring you the most compelling stories from across the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis

programme.title: Stargate SG-1

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Approaching Sixty: The former steeplejack and renowned engineering expert looks back on his eventful life with a sense of satisfaction and contentment. Ep6

programme.desc: Guy Martin helps with the restoration of the oldest surviving Brixham sailing trawler and discovers how Britain acquired its taste for fish and chips.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel & Stone
programme.desc: The Victorian Gentleman: Recalling Fred Dibnah's love of 19th-century life, as well as his admiration for great feats such as Tower Bridge and Eastnor Castle.

programme.desc: Riches Beneath the Earth: Fred Dibnah's fascination with mining, which led him to dig his own coal mine in his back garden, and teach viewers about the dangers.
